column5: what size 3/4, 1, 1.5oz bottom bouncers you guys use on gouin and places like lake hebert for the walleyes on bright days?
Kinda depends on what you're pulling, how fast you're going and how deep you're fishing...I use whatever gives me a bit more than a 45 degree angle (slightly steeper). Not much help I guess...

When looking to locate walleye, you need to have a two oz bottom bouncer, trolled at 1 1/2 to 2 mph. while you are cruising around, this will ensure your bouncer will stay in contact with the bottom run out plenty of line. Once you have located them in lets say 14' of water you may cut back on the weights. Its like drifting and jigging, need to stay in contact with the bottom. Back trolling works well on Hebert ,giving they have 20 hp mercs can be a little fast for reg trolling
